SEARCH
Package com.dimon.managers

Class FileDescriptor

java.lang.Object
com.dimon.managers.FileDescriptor
public class FileDescriptor extends Object
Manages file-related operations for temporary and final file handling in the protocol. Provides methods to initialize temporary files, append fragments, finalize file transfers, and reset the file descriptor state.

  • Method Details

    • readFileToBytes

      public byte[] readFileToBytes(File file) throws IOException
      Reads the content of a file and converts it into a byte array.
      Parameters:
      file - the file to be read.
      Returns:
      a byte array containing the file's content.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while reading the file.

    • initializeTemporaryFile

      public void initializeTemporaryFile(String fileName) throws IOException
      Initializes a temporary file in the destination folder with the specified name. If the temporary file already exists, it will be deleted.
      Parameters:
      fileName - the name of the temporary file to be created.
      Throws:
      IOException - if the temporary file cannot be created or deleted.

    • appendFragmentToFile

      public void appendFragmentToFile(byte[] fragment) throws IOException
      Appends a fragment of data to the temporary file at the current position.
      Parameters:
      fragment - the data fragment to append.
      Throws:
      IOException - if the temporary file is not initialized or the fragment is invalid.

    • finalizeFileTransfer

      public void finalizeFileTransfer(String destinationPath) throws IOException
      Finalizes the file transfer by closing the temporary file, renaming it to the final destination, and optionally opening the final file in the system's default application.
      Parameters:
      destinationPath - the path where the final file will be saved.
      Throws:
      IOException - if the file cannot be closed, renamed, or opened.

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets the state of the file descriptor by closing and removing the temporary file, and resetting all positions and references.

    • deleteTemporaryFile

      public void deleteTemporaryFile()
      Deletes the temporary file if it exists.
